summary:
A 60-year-old patient with a history of severe depression, worsened by the loss of her daughter.
She has a history of ovarian cancer, diagnosed at age 38, and is a former smoker.
Currently on multiple psychiatric medications (Olanzapine, Quetiapine, Escitalopram), digestive medications (Omeprazole), and Dulcolax for constipation.
Has grade II hepatic steatosis and a simple renal cyst, according to recent tests.
The patient is being monitored for psychological health due to grief and is receiving self-care guidance.
Her physical therapy includes muscle strengthening, mobility exercises, and postural training, with good progress despite initial resistance.
The patient is also struggling with insomnia and deep sadness, with ongoing adjustments to psychiatric medications.
